result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. Burchett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 22OU835, 22OU2783, 22OU3270 Uncharged Referral Dismissed and Read In. **AMENDED 10/18/22 - length of probation amended from 3 years to 2 years.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to complete an AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is not to associate with any drug users or drug dealers.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.  The Defendant is subject to random drug/UA testing. Defendant is to apply to veteran's treatment court and comply with all conditions, if accepted.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Restitution summary - Restitution $ 53.92
Surcharge $ 5.39

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days). No contact with Woodmans.
Defendant requests an attorney.  Further Proceedings scheduled in Court Commissioner. Defendant has 10 days to sign bond.
Further proceedings on November 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
